Since the Treaty of Nerchinsk (1689), the Russian Empire has recognized the Argun river and the Stanovoy mountains as the natural frontiers between Russia and China.  In the mid 19th century the Russians would expand beyond this border to seize the vast lands between the Stanovoy Mountains and the Amur River. The Western Allies would later bring the Second Opium War to a conclusion by burning the Chinese Emperor's summer palaces, and entering Peking. A cunning major general named Nikolay Ignatiev was able to convinced the Chinese that only Russian support would cause the allies to evacuate Peking. The price for this support was the Convention of Peking, which confirmed Muravyov's gains and, additionally, ceded territory between the Ussuri River and the Pacific to Russia. Thus, Russia had gained some 350,000 square miles of territory without firing a single shot.

ìLa France, l'armÈe, tÍte d'armÈe, JosÈphine Öî\nThose were the last words of the Emperor of the French. The man who changed the world, the man who changed war, gone forever. Napoleon Bonaparte did not designate an heir for the date of his death, but he did proclaim that when glory returned to France FranÁois Joseph would return as "The Righteous One" this gives us the opportunity for our next ruler to be FranÁois Joseph. However, he is currently with Murat and has been advised by him. He has received teachings through personal letters from Napoleon to his own son. As an alternative to that we have Louis who is preferred by Napoleon's brothers and has a certain legitimacy, in addition to having learned more and obtained many values from Napoleon when he was with him. The problem with this would be that Louis is not in himself someone who can follow the same ideals, since Louis has not been given as much of the ideas that were given to FranÁois Joseph himself and in fact looks strongly influenced by the Bonaparte court and family.
We will walk the path of FranÁois Joseph.ßR European Path

Those were the last words of the Emperor of the French. The man who changed the world, the man who changed war, gone forever.

However, deep within Napoleon, as he was dying, something stirred. He felt pride for what he had accomplished, but he knew that if he let things go, it would fall apart. No, he would stand up for France, and for the Revolution. Napoleon, though gone physically, was here to stay.

After many long years in the frigid north of Canada, Napoleon is back in town. Already counter-revolutionary forces are mounting to kick Napoleon back out of europe. Napoleon was heard commenting about how he "Never thought he would see the greatest city on earth again", although he "never lost hope in the dream of the Revolution".
The Napoleonic Dynasty Returns to Paris!

Although the man himself is no longer around to see it, the revolution is alive and well in Paris once more. Many lost hope when Napoleon died, but his successor has been surprisingly effective, and has returned the dynasty to Paris.
